markdownRemark.html:
Smoke from Canada's wildfires blanketed parts of the Midwest, prompting officials to urge residents to stay indoors. The air quality index reached "very unhealthy" levels in many cities, leading to closures of public pools and the disappearance of the skyline in Chicago. My colleague Julie Bosman reported that this is likely not the last of the smoke this summer. In other news, the Kremlin insisted that Russia's army has President Vladimir Putin's back, despite reports of a senior general having advance knowledge of a rebel's plans. In Ukraine, troops are facing an enemy nearly as daunting as the Russians: the terrain. President Biden claimed credit for the economic recovery, and a special counsel is moving forward with an investigation into Donald Trump's efforts to remain in power after the 2020 election.

  1. Smoke from Canadian wildfires is affecting air quality in the Midwest.
  2. U.S. officials believe a senior Russian general had advance knowledge of Yevgeny Prigozhin’s plans to rebel against Russia’s military leadership.
  3. President Biden is claiming credit for the economic recovery.
  4. Donald Trump is being investigated by the special counsel for his efforts to remain in power after the 2020 election.
  5. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is using his family name and support from the tech world to secure a foothold in the 2024 presidential contest.

"1. Smoke from Canadian wildfires is affecting air quality in the Midwest - like a distant storm cloud bringing unexpected rain.2. U.S. officials believe a senior Russian general had advance knowledge of Yevgeny Prigozhin’s plans to rebel against Russia’"

frontmatter.title: Smoke Blankets Midwest Cities: Stay Indoors
